alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Clinton; Howard (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Carroll, central Tippecanoe, northwestern Clinton and northwestern Howard Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Logansport to near Lafayette. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Carroll, central Tippecanoe, northwestern Clinton and northwestern Howard Counties, including the following locations... Mulberry, Flora, Rossville, Dayton, Burlington and Shadeland. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 162 and 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central, north central and west central Indiana.
